message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE

This paper is about aspect-term level sentiment analysis, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and falls under the category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The proposed model, CAPSAR, is based on a capsule network, which is a type of neural network that has gained popularity in recent years and is often used in computer vision tasks. Therefore, cs.LG (machine learning) is also a likely sub-category. The model also involves learning interactive patterns between aspects and sentiments, which suggests the use of artificial intelligence (cs.AI). The task of sentiment analysis is closely related to information retrieval (cs.IR), as it involves extracting relevant information from text. Finally, the use of a novel approach to handle unknown aspect terms suggests the use of techniques from neural engineering (cs.NE).
